title: Add/remove store from list
text: Open DdD backoffice Support Tools Find client Under Client Rights, you can remove and add stores Remember to add Priority numbers if they are not filled in already. An optional number can be entered, but it is recommended to follow the number sequence. This is the order in which stores appear in the Backoffice. Remember to click Update Client Rights at the end. If the change does not show on the POS immediately, run a Reload or Restart.
description:
Open DdD backoffice Support Tools 

  

Find client 

  

Under Client Rights, you can remove and add stores 

Remember to add Priority numbers if they are not filled in already. An optional number can be entered, but it is recommended to follow the number sequence. This is the order in which stores appear in the Backoffice. 

Remember to click Update Client Rights at the end. 

  

If the change does not show on the POS immediately, run a Reload or Restart.

title: Branch number
text: If a client asks what their branch number (filial nr) is, this can be checked under Create/Edit under Edit/Create System -> Create/Edit Group: Branch number is usually the last 3 digtis Så kan du se hvilke filialer firmaet har.
description:
If a client asks what their branch number (filial nr) is, this can be checked under Create/Edit under Edit/Create System -> Create/Edit Group: 

Branch number is usually the last 3 digtis


Så kan du se hvilke filialer firmaet har.

title: E-mail adress – create/check for resending of login data
text: Attention!!! The client can only use official mail adresses, no gmail or yahoo.
description: Attention!!! The client can only use official mail adresses, no gmail or yahoo.

title: Error on receipt of goods
text: If the POS pops up with a window showing codes upon accepting receipt of goods, this means that the No lables at receipt of goods is not ticked in DdD Backoffice Support Tools.
description: If the POS pops up with a window showing codes upon accepting receipt of goods, this means that the No lables at receipt of goods is not ticked in DdD Backoffice Support Tools.

title: Login cycles back to Client ID login
text: If login to BO fails and the login returns to the Client ID login after you enter the Machine login info, try to delete the cache and reset it completely. If this does not work, make sure the client is using the connrect URL to log in. You can find the login info in Backoffice Support Tools If the customer wants to access Backoffice from a new PC, they first have to try doing it on their own. That is why we have made the manuals. If the customer is difficult to find, use wildcards search of clients.
description:
If login to BO fails and the login returns to the Client ID login after you enter the Machine login info, try to delete the cache and reset it completely. 

If this does not work, make sure the client is using the connrect URL to log in. 

 

You can find the login info in Backoffice Support Tools 

  

  

If the customer wants to access Backoffice from a new PC, they first have to try doing it on their own. That is why we have made the manuals. 

  

If the customer is difficult to find, use wildcards search of clients.

title: Help with BO Login
text: When the customer is logged out of Backoffice, for example when starting up on a new computer or due to the routinely log out after 180 days, you are not supposed to give the credentials via telephone or Teamviewer! The customer can give you an official mailadress for the company. We do not accept hotmail/gmail/... mailadresses (unless it is a small shop that does not have its own domain). White list the customers mailadress in Support tools Afterwards the customer can get the credentials by putting her/his mailadress in here: The email that the customer receives does contain the Klient-ID, Klient-KODE as well as all Machine passwords, but it doesn't contain the password for the personal User log in. If the customer has forgotten his/her password for the personal User, they have to log in with another user that has Master rights and view the password. How this is to be done by the customer, is described in Helpdesk : K3 Support (freshdesk.com).
description:
When the customer is logged out of Backoffice, for example when starting up on a new computer or due to the routinely log out after 180 days, you are not supposed to give the credentials via telephone or Teamviewer!

The customer can give you an official mailadress for the company. We do not accept hotmail/gmail/... mailadresses (unless it is a small shop that does not have its own domain).

White list the customers mailadress in Support tools

 

Afterwards the customer can get the credentials by putting her/his mailadress in here:



The email that the customer receives does contain the Klient-ID, Klient-KODE as well as all Machine passwords, but it doesn't contain the password for the personal User log in.

If the customer has forgotten his/her password for the personal User, they have to log in with another user that has Master rights and view the password. How this is to be done by the customer, is described in Helpdesk : K3 Support (freshdesk.com).

title: Logout user
text: If the client cannot log into Backoffice and gets the message that they are already logged in, use support tools Find clientnumber Click Menu and Logout User Find client through the client number Doubleclick and confirm that you want to log the client out Tell the client to try logging in again.
description:
If the client cannot log into Backoffice and gets the message that they are already logged in, use support tools 

  

Find clientnumber 

  

Click Menu and Logout User 

Find client through the client number 

  

Doubleclick and confirm that you want to log the client out 

  

Tell the client to try logging in again.

title: Reports - printout does not appear on POS
text: Possible reason is that client or group is not set to be user report recipient If client is an user report recipient the following reports can only be fetched by specific BO-user related clerk logged into DdDPOS no matter if the report was ordered in DdD BO or in DdDPOS context: Stock: Receipt for Update of Receipt of Goods Receipt for Item Transfer Reports: Picking List (50) Financial Report (166) Stock List classified by age (15) Inventory: Location List (11) Inventory List (12) Do not set all clients in group are "user report recipients" when there is an operating HQ (Back Office Support Tools->Group setup->Miscellaneous->Miscellaneous). Then set Client is "user report recipients" individually per client as in the screenshot above. In other words - Retail in a Box is configured at the level of clients instead of at the level of group.
description:
Possible reason is that client or group is not set to be user report recipient



If client is an user report recipient the following reports can only be fetched by specific BO-user related clerk logged into DdDPOS no matter if the report was ordered in DdD BO or in DdDPOS context:

  • Stock:
    • Receipt for Update of Receipt of Goods
    • Receipt for Item Transfer
  • Reports:
    • Picking List (50)
    • Financial Report (166)
    • Stock List classified by age (15)
  • Inventory:
    • Location List (11)
    • Inventory List (12)

Do not set all clients in group are "user report recipients" when there is an operating HQ (Back Office Support Tools->Group setup->Miscellaneous->Miscellaneous). Then set Client is "user report recipients" individually per client as in the screenshot above.

In other words - Retail in a Box is configured at the level of clients instead of at the level of group.

title: Change Label-ID DdD /Common Price Tags
text: There are different price tags for each group or concern and they follow a particular label-ID for their labels. The customer can contact us regarding a problem that when they print a label,the size or price of the item overlaps other information on the label as shown.The customer is using label-id 519. List of all price tags is also attached below. In such case, we need to change the pric tags id and select the right one which has also all information about the product. After trying a few examples,it is concluded that label-id 570 is perfect in this case. When label id is changed from 519 to 570 in DdD support tools(Note:Remember Reload on POS) ,the print out was perfect.
description:
There are different price tags for each group or concern and they follow a particular label-ID for their labels.
The customer can contact us regarding a problem that when they print a label,the size or price of the item overlaps other information on the label as shown.The customer is using label-id 519.
List of all price tags is also attached below.


In such case, we need to change the pric tags id and select the right one which has also all information about the product.
After trying a few examples,it is concluded that label-id 570 is perfect in this case.
When label id is changed from 519 to 570 in DdD support tools(Note:Remember Reload on POS) ,the print out was perfect.

title: Copy product lines between Groups-DdD Support Tools
text: When a new store is operated,adding manual product groups is one of the important step that needs to be done. Manual product groups as standard contains gift cards/credit vouchers, morning and evening inventory with cash register, bank deposits and costs and each of them must have a specific item group number. The procedure is as follows. First login to DdD support tools as support agent with the following link. DdD backoffice - SupportTools\support_login.htm From the main interface,select the menu 4 which is Copy product lines between groups. As these manual product lines are standard and is same for all groups,so we can choose a source group and a destination group where it needs to be copied. In the below example, we are copying the item groups from group 367 to group 621. Select the desired item groups which are 9911-9912-9913-9914-9921-9922-9923 and 9924. The last step is to click on the Copy button,so it will transfer all the selected item gorups and thus will be visible in DdD backoffice. Screenshot for copied item groups in DdD backoffice.
description:
When a new store is operated,adding manual product groups is one of the important step that needs to be done.

Manual product groups as standard contains gift cards/credit vouchers, morning and evening inventory with cash register, bank deposits and costs and each of them must have a specific item group number.


The procedure is as follows.

First login to DdD support tools as support agent with the following link.
DdD backoffice - SupportTools\support_login.htm

From the main interface,select the menu 4 which is Copy product lines between groups.


As these manual product lines are standard and is same for all groups,so we can choose a source group and a destination group where it needs to be copied.

In the below example, we are copying the item groups from group 367 to group 621.

Select the desired item groups which are 9911-9912-9913-9914-9921-9922-9923 and 9924.

The last step is to click on the Copy button,so it will transfer all the selected item gorups and thus will be visible in DdD backoffice.




Screenshot for copied item groups in DdD backoffice.
